qas.question: What do some Belgian cities hold during Lent?
What Carnival takes place on Laetare Sunday?
What group of participants attack bystanders with confetti and dried pig bladders?
What day does the town of Halle engage in its celebration?
What's the name of Belgium's oldest parade?

context: Some Belgian cities hold <a0_0>Carnivals<a0_0/> during Lent. One of the best-known is Stavelot, where <a1_0>the Carnival de la Laetare<a1_0/> takes place on Laetare Sunday, the fourth Sunday of Lent. The participants include the <a2_0>Blancs-Moussis<a2_0/>, who dress in white, carry long red noses and parade through town attacking bystanders with confetti and dried pig bladders. The town of Halle also celebrates on <a3_0>Laetare Sunday<a3_0/>. Belgium's oldest parade is the <a4_0>Carnival Parade of Maaseik<a4_0/>, also held on Laetare Sunday, which originated in 1865.
